    • Method Detail

      • getContentElements

        Set<HTMLElement> getContentElements(Context ctx)

        Get the content element model given the specified context for this element.

        This is not meant to be completely accurate as it doesn't define structure, but is intended to be used to provide immediate feedback to application developers and generated content. For accurate validation, use an [X]HTML validator.

        Parameters:
        ctx - the context of this element. ctx.getElement() should be this element. This is optional. If not specified, return the most restrictive set of elements.
        Returns:
        the most restrictive set of elements given the specified parameters. This set should be mutable.

      • isTransparent

        boolean isTransparent(Context ctx)
        Test if the element's content model is transparent.
        Parameters:
        ctx - the context of this element. Optional.
        Returns:
        true or false.

      • isValidParent

        boolean isValidParent(Context ctx)
                      throws IllegalArgumentException
        Test if this element can have a specific element as a parent.
        Parameters:
        ctx - the context of this element. ctx.getElement() should be this element and it must provide a parent context/element.
        Returns:
        true or false.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the context doesn't provide a parent context/element.

      • kind

        Element.Kind kind()
        Get the kind of element.
        Returns:
        the kind.

      • name

        String name()
        The name of the element in lower-case.
        Returns:
        the name.
